body_html:
@concretevitamin

I doubt we'll working on this since we haven't seen much demand.

FYI - the Flickr 100m image dataset (and by extension the multimedia creative commons image dataset) has many (~0.5% I think...) EXIF formatted JPG files, which currently break with tf.image.decode_image and tf.image.decode_jpeg. Also I find it surprising that there is not much demand for dealing with images taken on smart phones considering "Tensorflow was designed with mobile and embedded platforms in mind." https://www.tensorflow.org/mobile/

It might be worth at least flagging this for contributions.

body:
@concretevitamin 
> I doubt we'll working on this since we haven't seen much demand.

FYI - the Flickr 100m image dataset (and by extension the multimedia creative commons image dataset) has many (~0.5% I think...) EXIF formatted JPG files, which currently break with tf.image.decode_image and tf.image.decode_jpeg. Also I find it surprising that there is not much demand for dealing with images taken on smart phones considering "Tensorflow was designed with mobile and embedded platforms in mind." https://www.tensorflow.org/mobile/

It might be worth at least flagging this for contributions.
